alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 10:57PM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Vernon Parish, southeastern Tyler, northern Newton and northeastern Jasper Counties through 1130 PM CST... At 1057 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Stringtown to near Mt. Union. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jasper, Newton, Kirbyville, Call, Fred, Burkeville, Farrsville, Magnolia Springs, Burr Ferry, Mayflower, Mt. Union, Spurger, Jamestown, Roganville, Harrisburg, Stringtown, Bleakwood, Wiergate and Evans. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
